subject: probability
title: Hypergeometric Distribution
contentHtml:
The hypergeometric distribution models sampling without replacement from a finite population.

Given a population of size N with K items of interest and M items not of interest, the probability of drawing k items of interest is given by:

\(P(X=k) = \frac{\binom{K}{k} \binom{N-K}{M-k}}{\binom{N}{M)}\)

This formula is useful in scenarios where you need to estimate the proportion of a specific type in a sample, but you can't replace items.
